org.jetel.hadoop.service.filesystem

Class HadoopPathResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.hadoop.service.filesystem.HadoopPathResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomPathResolver

    public class HadoopPathResolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomPathResolver
    CustomPathResolver providing access to Hadoop Distributed File System. Note that methods of this class assume that Hadoop connection involved is already initialized. If someone really has to use methods of this class when the connection is not initialized, they have to init() and free() the connection themselves! If this class would init() the connection, it would have no way how to close the connection in the right moment in the future.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String input)
      Method should return input stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute.
      java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String input, boolean appendData, int compressLevel)
      Method should return output stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute.
      java.lang.String getPathWithQueryAndFragment(java.net.URI inputURI) 
      java.net.URL getURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should return URL object with proper URLStreamHandler & URLConnection allowing to process openStream() and openConnection() methods
      boolean handlesURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should return true if this CustomPathResolver handles specified URL - protocol Note that if the method returns true, the resolver must implement both CustomPathResolver.getInputStream(URL, String) and CustomPathResolver.getOutputStream(URL, String, boolean, int).
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> resolveWildcardURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should resolve wildcard URL - i.e. return list of concrete files/URLs

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                 java.lang.String input)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomPathResolver
        Method should return input stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute. If null is returned the other CustomPathResolver implementation are used and finally if none of them has success the default clover implementation is used.
        Specified by:
        getInputStream in interface CustomPathResolver
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        input - URL of the source file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • handlesURL

        public boolean handlesURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                 java.lang.String fileURL)
        Description copied from interface: CustomPathResolver
        Method should return true if this CustomPathResolver handles specified URL - protocol

        Note that if the method returns true, the resolver must implement both CustomPathResolver.getInputStream(URL, String) and CustomPathResolver.getOutputStream(URL, String, boolean, int).

        Specified by:
        handlesURL in interface CustomPathResolver
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        fileURL - URL of the source file
